history.content: Here! Or the course advice facebook page.

(Context: I've taken 170 and 61C, have friends who've taken 16A, know virtually nothing about PolEcon 100)

170 + 61C is a pretty heavy combo, mainly because they are both classes that have large amounts of constant work (unlike other classes that are more burst-oriented in terms of work). 16A is also a hard class in terms of workload, but the extent of effort might depend on whether you've taken 54 before or not. 

If you have a decent study/friend group for at least one of the classes that you can rely on to help you out, it's definitely possible to pull it all off (having a group for a class like 170 really helps, because you only really need one person in the group to have a Eureka moment for any particular problem); if you don't, however, you might be better off leaving out 16A for now. 

__________________________________

HKN has good course guides on their website that also talk about workload for each EECS course: https://hkn.eecs.berkeley.edu/courseguides

Hi! What's the best place to ask for an opinion on whether I can handle a certain schedule this fall? Asking because all the doors on 3rd floor Soda seem to be closed and I just wanted a peer's opinion on whether my current schedule is overdoing it. Thanks.

Gracias por the reply :) So I'm enrolled in CS 170, CS 61C, EE 16A, and Polecon 100 at the moment, and I'm 99% sure that I want to drop either 16A or Polecon 100. Reason 1 is I think 170 and 61C are both very useful and I want to keep them. Reason 2 is that I think I can handle at most 3 out of my current 4 classes. I squeaked into the CS major with a 3.33. I also want to spend more time than in the past (read: any time at all) on personal projects and recruiting this semester.

So should I drop 16A to have more time for other things, or is there hope that I can do 170, 61C, and 16A together while still spending a good amount of time on my extracurriculars?
